pullRequest.body:
Define `SimplexCategoryGenRel` as the category presented by generators and relation by the following data:
  - Objects are natural numbers. The constructor is `SimplexCategoryGenRel.mk`.
  - Morphisms are generated by two classes of morphisms : `δ {n : ℕ} (i : Fin (n + 2)) : mk n ⟶ mk (n + 1)` and `σ {n : ℕ} (i : Fin (n + 1)) : mk (n + 1) ⟶ mk n`
  - Morphisms are subject to the simplicial relations, i.e the relations proven for `SimplexCategory` in `AlgebraicTopology/SimplexCategory.lean`

We provide induction principles for objects and morphisms for this category, and construct a canonical functor to `SimplexCategory`.

Part of a series of PR formalising that `SimplexCategoryGenRel` is equivalent to `SimplexCategory`.

---

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go

<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
```

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
Apart from some little syntax improvements, this looks good to me!

```suggestion
We introduce `SimplexCategoryGenRel` as the category presented by generating
```

```suggestion
/-- A morphism in `FreeSimplexQuiver` is either a face map (`δ`) or a degeneracy map (`σ`). -/
```
Instead of `simplicial1`, etc, the names of the constructors could be parallel to the corresponding lemmas like `δ_comp_δ`, etc.

This may be slightly better:
```suggestion
lemma morphismProperty_eq_top (P : MorphismProperty SimplexCategoryGenRel)
```

I think `rec` is the standard name for these:
```suggestion
protected def rec {P : SimplexCategoryGenRel → Sort*}
```

In other categories, we typically have `hom_ext` and `ext`:
```suggestion
lemma ext {x y : SimplexCategoryGenRel} (h : x.len = y.len) : x = y := by
```
It seems this is `SimplexCategory.SimplexCategoryGenRel`. I would think `SimplexCategoryGenRel` would be better.

The coercion from `ℕ` to `Fin` does not have good definitional properties. It would be easier to avoid it. If you absolutely need a version with natural numbers, I think it should be phrased as:
```suggestion
/-- A version of δ_comp_δ with indices in `ℕ` satisfying relevant inequalities. -/
lemma δ_comp_δ_nat {n} (i j : ℕ) (hi : i < n + 2) (hj : j < n + 2) (H : i ≤ j) :
    δ ⟨i, hi⟩ ≫ δ ⟨j + 1, by omega⟩ = δ ⟨j, hj⟩ ≫ δ ⟨i, by omega⟩ :=
  δ_comp_δ (n := n) (i := ⟨i, by omega⟩) (j := ⟨j, by omega⟩) (by simpa)
```

```suggestion
def toSimplexCategory : SimplexCategoryGenRel ⥤ SimplexCategory :=
  CategoryTheory.Quotient.lift _
    (Paths.lift
      { obj := .mk
        map f := match f with
          | FreeSimplexQuiver.Hom.δ i => SimplexCategory.δ i
          | FreeSimplexQuiver.Hom.σ i => SimplexCategory.σ i })
    (fun _ _ _ _ h ↦ by
      cases h with
      | simplicial1 H => exact SimplexCategory.δ_comp_δ H
      | simplicial2 H => exact SimplexCategory.δ_comp_σ_of_le H
      | simplicial3₁ => exact SimplexCategory.δ_comp_σ_self
      | simplicial3₂ => exact SimplexCategory.δ_comp_σ_succ
      | simplicial4 H => exact SimplexCategory.δ_comp_σ_of_gt H
      | simplicial5 H => exact SimplexCategory.σ_comp_σ H)
```

pullRequest.title: feat(AlgebraicTopology/SimplexCategory/GeneratorsRelations): the category `SimplexCategoryGenRel`

source.title: Tracking issue: definition of simplicial objects by generators and relations.

nodes.body: Apart from some little syntax improvements, this looks good to me!
